article_text:
BERLIN—Volkswagen AG, Europe's biggest automotive group, said sales of its namesake brand cars in the first eight months of the year rose 3.4%, but growth nearly stalled in August and sales continue falling sharply in Russia, the U.S. and Brazil.

The Volkswagen brand, which includes the Golf compact, Passat sedans and station wagons, and the Tiguan and Touran sport-utility vehicles, sold 4.3 million vehicles from January to August, up...
